# accessibilityVisibleCharacterRange()

**Instance Method**

Returns the range of visible characters in the document.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func accessibilityVisibleCharacterRange() -> NSRange
```

## Return Value

The range of the visible characters in the document. This method should return the range for entire lines. Characters that are horizontally clipped are included in this range.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityVisibleCharacterRange] property.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityAttributedString(for:)**: Returns the attributed substring for the specified range of characters.
- **accessibilityValue()**: Returns the text that the accessibility element displays.
